author: John Johnson
quote: First, solve the problem. Then write the code.

author: Anonymous
quote: It is not a bug, it is an undocumented feature.

author: Oscar Wilde
quote: Experience is the name everyone gives to their mistakes.

author: Robert C. Martin
quote: Clean code always looks like it was written by someone who cares.

author: Linus Torvalds
quote: Talk is cheap. Show me the code.

author: Jim Highsmith
quote: The best way to get a project done faster is to start sooner.

author: Austin Freeman
quote: Simplicity is the soul of efficiency.

author: Ron Jeffries
quote: Code never lies, comments sometime do.

author: Harold Abelson
quote: Programs must be written for people to read, and only the incidentally for machines to execute.

author: Doug Linder
quote: A good programmer is someone who looks both ways before crossing a onw-way street.

author: Donald Knuth
quote: Premature optimization is the root of all evil.

author: Grace Hopper
quote: The most dangerous phrase in the language is, 'We've always done it this way.'

author: Dennis Ritchie
quote: UNIX is basically a simple operating system, but you have to be a genius to understand the simplicity.

author: Brian Kernighan
quote: Debugging is twice as hard as writing the code in the first place.

author: Bjarne Stroustrup
quote: C makes it easy to shoot yourself in the foot; C++ makes it harder, but when you do it blows your whole leg off.

author: Robert C. Martin
quote: Clean code always looks like it was written by someone who cares.

author: Ken Thompson
quote: One of my most productive days was throwing away 1000 lines of code.

author: Steve Jobs
quote: Everybody in this country should learn to program a computer... because it teaches you how to think.

author: Ada Lovelace
quote: That brain of mine is something more than merely mortal, as time will show.
